tool.name: tarfast5
tool.command: #for $file in $inputs: ln -s $file ${file.element_identifier}.fast5 && #end for #if $output_format == "gzip": export PIGZ="-p \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4}" && tar -cvh --use-compress-program=pigz -f $output *.fast5 #else: tar -cvh -f $output *.fast5 #end if
tool.help:
**What it does**
Creates a tar.gz archive of fast5 (h5) sequences files
.. class:: warningmark
This tools follows a "map-reduce" procedure: multiple inputs, that can be arranged as a data collection, are compressed into a single tar.gz archive.
**Output**
A fast5.tar.gz archive
